subject: Re: Question for box users
author: Rebecca
full_text:
Steve --

Thank you for your reply.  So, if we have 14 min of dead time 
before "clyde" appears and you edit the 14 mins, is there any other 
radio band "noise" that appears or is it simply quiet?  Also, can you 
be so sure that deleting these 14 mins that there aren't other 
messages on other frequencies to retrieve?

Greatly appreciate your opinion on this matter,

- Rak

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...> wrote:
>
> I edit my files to display the answer, i.e---if i ask what is your 
name 
> and 14 seconds later they say "clyde".  At that point i will cut 
out 
> the 14 seconds of nothing and just leave the answer to my 
question.  
> Sometimes i have to make the file a bit louder, but no mods to the 
> actual file.  It is what it is and i leave it in raw format for all 
to 
> hear, the less you mess with the files is better to bring people 
onto 
> this side of the fence.
> 
> -Steve H.
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Rebecca" <rak4dds@> wrote:
> >
> > Hello All -
> > 
> > I have been studying this format of communication for better part 
of 
> a 
> > year now.  I have been listening to clips and reading posts here 
for 
> > sometime and am impressed with direction of your work.  The 
majority 
> of 
> > clips I've listened to, regardless of the type of box used, are 
quite 
> > clear.  My question to you is as follows:  are the files edited 
or 
> > changed at all or is this the quality they are coming through 
at?  
> > 
> > - Rak
> >
>
